creator: match@dimensional.com
text:
ServletConfig.getServletName always returns "jsp" for a JSP page. Is this
correct? I tested with JRun... it returns the name of the compiled servlet.

This is normal for Tomcat 3.2.x and Tomcat 4.0, where "jsp" is the name given
to Jasper's "wrapper" servlet which invokes the JSP's servlet.  Tomcat 3.3
doesn't use Jasper's "wrapper" servlet.  Instead 3.3 JspInterceptor to
translate, compile, and load the class. As a result, you will see a servlet name
closer to what you expect.  Regardless, none of the above behavior constitues
a bug.
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
